page.title: 10FIRE STATION AND FINE WIRES
page.content: The new Fire Station,which is modern, replaced the old one now used for storage.There are two appliances with one reserve.Thirty-two people are employed at the station. Fine Wires occupy three buildings which were used for I&R Morley,the hosiery company.The first of three buildings was built in 1885.Fine Wires make a variety of wires.80% of British telephone cords are made there and the braided gold wires for the insides of N.A.T.O.Man Pack radios. In 1872 the Great Northern Railway Co. built a line from Bulwell to Nettlefield,passing through Arnot Hill Park,with a branch line to Nottingham. After World War 2,the line was closed, the rails removed,and the land sold privately.At present there are 8 passenger routes passing through the area. S.Jamson
